intro: Premna oblongifolia var. major, commonly known as the large-leaf Premna, is a shrub or small tree native to Southeast Asia. It features ovate to elliptical leaves that are typically 5–15 cm in length, with a smooth or slightly hairy upper surface. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, followed by small, fleshy berries that turn red when mature. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical forests. The leaves are used in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory and antimicrobial properties.
